jconsole

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • jconsole.Console

  • public final class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides platform-independent access to lowlevel console functions.

    The underlying library is initialized automatically after the class has been loaded, but should be manually deinitialized using shutdown() to return the console to its original operating mode.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clear()
      Clears the console window and resets the text and background color to the default.
      static void moveCursor(int x, int y)
      Moves the cursor instantly to the specified coordinates.
      static void print(java.lang.String text)
      Prints the specified text starting at the current cursor position which may be set using moveCursor(int, int).
      static char readCharacter()
      Waits until any key is pressed and returns the corresponding character.
      static void showCursor(boolean show)
      Sets the visibility of the cursor.
      static void shutdown()
      Deinitializes the native library and return the console to its original operating mode.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Deinitializes the native library and return the console to its original operating mode.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clears the console window and resets the text and background color to the default.

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.String text)
        Prints the specified text starting at the current cursor position which may be set using moveCursor(int, int). A linebreak should be represented by "\n\r".
        Parameters:
        text - Text to print

      • showCursor

        public static void showCursor(boolean show)
        Sets the visibility of the cursor. A visible cursor may be represented differently on different platforms.
        Parameters:
        show - true to show the cursor, false to hide it

      • moveCursor

        public static void moveCursor(int x,
                              int y)
        Moves the cursor instantly to the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - Column to move to
        y - Row to move to

      • readCharacter

        public static char readCharacter()
        Waits until any key is pressed and returns the corresponding character.
        Returns:
        Character representation of the pressed key
